services that you access over an HTTP API those are things like recognition for video and for pictures transcribe
for doing speech to text translate for doing English to German or French to English and all kinds of things like
that and then Polly for doing text-to-speech and comprehend for doing the the analytics portion of text so if
we want to detect the parts of speech if we want to detect the sentiment if we want to detect the the key entities and
then Lex for communicating with our families and friends it's a chatbot service and then at the platform level
services we have Amazon sage maker and Amazon EMR and glue and Mechanical Turk and these are tools that make it very
easy to accomplish machine learning at scale with a managed platform and then
underlying all of that are our frameworks and interfaces and infrastructure and that infrastructure level is powered by things like our p3

we have there it's actually quad for kated I don't know if that's a real word into like four different services so
there's Kinesis data streams KD s KD s is billed and scaled on the concept of
shards where a shard gives you a one megabyte of ingest and two megabytes per second so one megabyte per second of
ingest and two megabytes per second of egress to be able to - basically as many
charges you want to provision you can do that so we have people who were ingesting you know hundreds of gigabytes
per second in Kinesis and kts streams and then egressing that as well and we
recently released a feature that I'm was supposed to publish a blog post about today but instead it's gonna come out tomorrow a few weeks ago we released a
feature called enhanced fan-out 4k ds4 Kinesis data streams that actually allows you to use an HTP to interface
which for those of you who aren't familiar with HP - it basically gives you a subscribe to shard api it gives
you a well HTTP - is a binary wrapper around a regular HTTP protocol that
allows you to have these kind of multiplex TCP connections that can deal
with a lot more data in a much more efficient way than traditional HTTP so instead of having to make one request
and one long-lived poling request the server can actually see in packets without you having to request
them which is really really useful in a streaming scenario so you can you can use this subscribe to shard API you can
say hey I want to connect to this Kinesis shard and I want to be able to have the server push down any of the
relevant info to me so it's pretty powerful again blog post about it coming out tomorrow and the second Kinesis
service is fire hose so fire hose is this ability to take all of that data
whether it's coming from a Kinesis stream or whether you're posting it directly into the firehose and send that into something else whether that's
Splunk elasticsearch s3 you know what
you can send it somewhere else it's basically a way to send it off to your data warehouse or something and then in
between those sits something called Kinesis analytics which is the ability to run regular sequel queries on that
streaming data so let's say you have JSON coming in and you wanted to run sequel queries on it you can actually run real time ml on that streaming data
